text:
Sun damage, skin cancer, and premature aging are just a few of the reasons we are major proponents of year-round sunscreen usage. And, while we have our go-to sunscreens, we've decided to take a little extra precaution this year by adding makeup with SPF into our routine. You can never be too prepared, right?

On the search to add some more sun protection into our beauty routine, we reached out to a few celebrity makeup artists for their favorite makeup products containing SPF. From protective lip tints that add just the right amount of color to high SPF BB creams that create a barely-there layer of coverage, there are plenty of products that fulfill their purpose while also protecting our skin from the sun's harsh rays. For the best makeup artist–recommended beauty products containing SPF, keep on reading.

Foundation Shiseido UV Protective Liquid Foundation SPF 42 $36 Shop

When looking for makeup with SPF, senior makeup artist at Antonio Prieto Salon Kristine Cruz says it's important to look for products that provide both UVA and UVB coverage. This foundation from Shiseido does just that, while also providing a nice layer of coverage that is water- and oil-resistant.

Lip Tint Fresh Sugar Tinted Lip Treatment SPF 15 $24 Shop

For those of you who have experienced a sunburn on your lips, you know the importance of a lip balm with SPF. Celebrity makeup artist Stevi Christine highly recommends this lip tint from Fresh, which comes in a variety of colors and offers sun protection up to SPF 15 as well.

Primer Laura Mercier Foundation Primer SPF 30 $38 Shop

The ultimate primer, Cruz says this formula evens out skintone, prolongs the wear of your foundation, and protects from both UVA and UVB rays. What more could you want?

Full-Coverage Foundation Chanel Les Beiges Foundation SPF 25 $60 Shop

Honey Artists makeup artist Min Min Ma prefers to use sunscreen as a sun barrier, however, she says that this full-coverage foundation protects from the sun's harsh rays, as well as environmental pollution, is a plus.

Setting Spray Coola Sunscreen Spray SPF 30 $25 Shop

Azra Red of Honey Artists Makeup artists says this mostly organic spray sunscreen is a staple in her makeup kit. Not only does she use it to set makeup before taking to the outdoors, but she also throws the travel-size version in her bag for touch-ups throughout the day.

Lip Balm Jane Iredale Lip Drink Lip Balm SPF 15 $15 Shop

The perfect hint of color with SPF 15, Red recommends this tinted lip balm made with better-for-you ingredients for year-round usage.

Tinted Moisturizer Jouer Luminizing Moisture Tint with SPF 20 $36 Shop

When switching makeup products for spring, opt for a tinted moisturizer with SPF. Christine recommends this one from Jouer, as she says it smoothes over imperfections and gives an all-around healthy glow.

BB Cream Amarte Natural Finish BB Cream SPF 36 $65 Shop

If you're looking for quick, flawless coverage come summer, Red recommends this high-SPF BB cream, which she says is a staple in her personal makeup kit.

Body Makeup Dermablend Leg and Body Makeup With SPF 25 $31 Shop

Looking for a faux glow? Instead of using self-tanners that don't protect from the sun's harsh rays, Ma recommends this buildable leg and body foundation that contains SPF 25.

Colorescience Sunforgettable Brush-On Sunscreen SPF 30 $65 Shop

Also keep a translucent powder with SPF of 30+, such as Colorescience Sunforgettable ($65,) in your purse and touch up throughout the day to maintain sun protection. “This is a great product for men, as the powder is light,” suggests Dr. Paul Friedman, M.D., director of the Dermatology & Laser Surgery Center in Houston Texas.
